intro: Hippomarathrum petraeum, commonly known as the rock dandelion, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It is a perennial herb that typically grows in rocky or sandy soils, thriving in arid and semi-arid environments. The plant features basal rosettes of fleshy, lance-shaped leaves that are covered in fine hairs. Its flowers are yellow and appear in late spring, followed by small, oval-shaped seed pods. Hippomarathrum petraeum is adapted to withstand drought and poor soil conditions, making it a resilient species in its native habitat.
